caption:
This photograph captures two seagulls standing atop a large pile of trash in a landfill setting. The foreground prominently features one seagull with its beak open as if squawking, while the other seagull is eating from a piece of waste it holds in its beak. Both birds appear weathered, possibly indicating their frequent presence in such environments.

The trash beneath their feet comprises a variety of discarded items such as plastic bags, pieces of paper, cloth, and smaller unidentifiable debris, showcasing a mix of colors but generally bearing a grimy appearance. The scene is set outdoors, evident from the natural light casting on the subjects.

In the slightly blurred background, a white trash collection vehicle is visible, indicating ongoing waste management activities. Beyond the immediate surroundings of the landfill, a faint hint of hills or mountain ranges can be seen, suggesting that this landfill is located near a less urban area or in a valley.

Overall, the image captures a moment that highlights issues of waste management, environmental impact, and how wildlife interacts with human-altered landscapes. The photo also conveys a sense of neglect and destruction, common in landfills, which directly impacts local fauna.
title: Seagulls scavenge at Croton landfill operation along the Hudson River
